intro: Aster ericoides var. strictus, commonly known as the dwarf heath aster, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact form and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white to purple, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as bogs and heathlands. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
